keyword: how many calories are in a pickle
title: How Many Calories Are in a Pickle?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a pickle—typically just 5 kcal per medium dill pickle—plus full nutrition breakdown, sodium details, and variations for your diet.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a Pickle?
assumptions: Medium dill pickle (~65 g), fermented in brine, no added sugar or spices beyond basic dill.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, type (dill vs. sweet), and preparation; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A medium dill pickle has about 5 calories and is very low in fat and protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories are in a dill pickle?
faqs.a: About 5 kcal for a medium-sized one.
Yes, typically 600+ mg per pickle due to the brine.

faqs.q: Do pickles have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Very little—around 0.3 g protein and 0.1 g fat per pickle.

faqs.q: What's the carb count in a pickle?
faqs.a: About 1.1 g carbs, including 0.5 g fiber, per medium pickle.

faqs.q: How do sweet pickles compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Higher at ~20 kcal due to added sugar.
